definition: to grasp firmly/to pay special attention to/to rush in/to make the most of
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to concentrate on studying hard
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment

sentences.english: I like big manor, likes to easy life, where the fresh air is relaxing.
sentences.chinese: 我喜好大庄园，那边的氛围新颖让人抓紧。

sentences.english: Sir , please don’t indulge yourself with idle daydreams. Take your time.
sentences.chinese: 先生，请您不要做白日梦，抓紧时间吧。

sentences.english: There being no time left , we must hurry .
sentences.chinese: 没剩多少时间了，我们必须抓紧。

sentences.english: Silvana tightened her grasp on her son.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦娜抓紧她的儿子。

sentences.english: The twist is captured in the hand.
sentences.chinese: 这个扭转的部分在手里抓紧。

sentences.english: I'm going to actually get caught up, make up for but Bawendi's slow lecturing.
sentences.chinese: 我得抓紧了，补上Bawendi上次没讲的内容。

sentences.english: Businesses helped themselves and relied on themselves to save the sector.
sentences.chinese: 企业方面，积极练好内功，抓紧行业自救。

sentences.english: Then I just grab and go in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 早上我就只需要抓紧时间走了。

sentences.english: Her fingers tightened in his hair.
sentences.chinese: 她的手指抓紧他的头发。

sentences.english: You must take time by the forelock and do it now.
sentences.chinese: 你必须抓紧时间，最好现在就去。

sentences.english: Hold on to ropes or to your seat when launching.
sentences.chinese: 在放艇时抓紧绳子或你的座位。

sentences.english: Please take the time to vote for him.
Clasping to the masts, he endured a sea that almost split the deck.
sentences.chinese: 他抓紧桅杆，顶着一阵差点儿把甲板冲成两半的海浪。

sentences.english: Grasp Jin Shenglie clothes Zhao Yangxian is very afraid.
sentences.chinese: 赵杨仙很是害怕的抓紧金圣烈的衣服。

sentences.english: A wrestling hold in which the opponent's arm is held so that it cannot be moved.
sentences.chinese: 摔跤擒拿法，抓紧对手的手臂令其动弹不得。

sentences.english: Take the time to do your job correctly or you may find yourself looking for a new one.
sentences.chinese: 抓紧时间做好工作，否则你会遇到新的问题。

definition: to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
to intensify/to speed up/to step up
as quickly as possible/as soon as possible/with all speed
see 儘快|尽快[jin3 kuai4]
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
as early as possible
at once/immediately
to put one's hand to it/to start out on a task/to set out
with all one's strength/full strength/all-out (effort)/fully (support)
hurriedly/without delay
to grab/to capture
to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
pressing/urgent
to supervise and urge completion of a task/to urge on
No time to lose! (idiom)
well/carefully/nicely/properly
as soon as possible/at the first opportunity/the sooner the better/before it's too late
